text: hba1c is a measure of how good your
blood glucose levels have been over a
period of about three months the test is
a good idea how high or low on average
your levels have been over that time a
sample of blood will be taken usually
from your arm the test measures the
amount of glucose that are stuck to the
hemoglobin in your blood the results may
be expressed as either a percentage or
in millimoles per mole the target for
people with diabetes is to get an hba1c
of under 6.5 percent this is the same as
being under 48 millimoles per mole
generally speaking the lower the hba1c
value the better some people however may
be said less challenging targets by
their doctor particularly where
hyperglycemia is of a concern a lot of
people get confused by the units of
hba1c diabetes Cotto UK has an hba1c
units converter on our website which
converts from percentages into
millimoles per mole and vice versa
